intro: Xanthocephalum gymnospermoides var. eglandulosum, commonly known as the glandular xanthocephalum, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or inland regions. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in winter. The variety is distinguished by its glandular structures on the stems and leaves, which contribute to its unique botanical features.
